alert.note: Alert for Dona Ana (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued August 11 at 6:38PM MDT until August 11 at 7:30PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: The National Weather Service in El Paso has issued a * Dust Advisory for... East central Dona Ana County in south central New Mexico... * Until 730 PM MDT. * At 637 PM MDT, an area of blowing dust was over NMSU Main Campus. HAZARD...Less than two miles visibility with strong winds around 35 mph. SOURCE...Detected by National Weather Service meteorologists. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes Interstate 10 in New Mexico between mile markers 141 and 153. Locations impacted include... Las Cruces, NMSU Main Campus, Mesilla, Mesquite, Talavera, San Pablo and Portions of Organ Mountains Desert Peaks National Monument. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
